courseDetails.title: Certification in Child Psychology and Child Development
courseDetails.shortDescription: Child Psychology | Early Childhood Education | Child Development | Safeguarding | Abuse Prevention | Child Safety
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you passionate about working with children? Do you want to make a meaningful impact on child development and ensure their safety and well-being?

This exclusive course is designed for individuals who wish to deepen their understanding of child psychology and safeguarding practices, prepare them with the knowledge and confidence to support children through every stage of growth, and protect them from harm.


Why Does This Course Matter?

Children are among the most vulnerable members of society, and ensuring child development and protection is crucial. This course provides the essential knowledge and practical skills needed to understand how children grow, think, and feel, and to safeguard children from abuse.


Whether you're a part of early childhood education, a caregiver, a social worker, or simply someone who works closely with children, understanding child psychology helps you respond appropriately to their emotional, social, and developmental needs. At the same time, safeguarding training ensures you can recognise signs of abuse, respond properly, and follow legal procedures to protect children at risk.


What's Special About This Course?

The course explores the whole journey of child development. You will start by exploring essential principles of child psychology, including theories of attachment, emotional development, moral growth, and the challenges children face during infancy through adolescence.


You’ll gain insights into conditions such as autism, ADHD, and intellectual disabilities, and learn how environmental factors like grief, separation, and family dynamics influence a child's development.


The course then moves into the area covering topics safeguarding children, offering training on how to identify, respond to, and prevent various forms of abuse, including emotional, physical, and sexual abuse.


You will get all information on safeguarding laws, child protection frameworks, risk assessments, online safety, and the importance of record-keeping. Special attention is also given to the needs of disabled children and children with SEND.


The topics of child psychology and safeguarding children combine to provide child development and child protection. This course enables you to make informed decisions, take responsible actions, and support the well-being of every child.

It's time to start your journey working with children in a safe, sensitive, and professional manner.

So, Enroll Now!

This course comes with the following Sections:


  1. Introduction to Child Psychology: Throughout this section, you’ll learn about psychology and child psychology. You’ll also learn about the different areas and stages of a child's growth and development.


  2. Overview of Attachment Theory in Childhood: Our course on child psychology, safeguarding, and early childhood development will cover attachment theories, phases, and elements here. The importance of early emotional ties between infants and their primary caregivers in influencing development will be covered in Bowlby's Attachment Theory.


  3. Understanding Privation, Deprivation, and Autism: Privation and deprivation have very negative effects on child development. This section will give you an in-depth look at autism, as well as the causes and symptoms of the condition.


  4. The Impacts of Grief and Separation on Child: This section of the course explores how grief and separation affect children emotionally, psychologically, and overall development. Learners will gain insight into the process of bereavement and how children of different ages respond to loss.


  5. Social and Emotional Development of a Child: This section will discuss child development and the areas of social and emotional development.


  6. Moral Development: The purpose of this section is to provide information on the moral development of children and theories on the development of morality.


  7. Factors Influencing the Development Process: Here, we will teach you about parenting issues, stress, and the significance of problem development.


  8. Problems During the Infancy Period: This section presents some common issues during the infant period, such as sleep and toileting problems, as well as intellectual disabilities, specific language delays, and specific learning disabilities.


  9. Understand the Childhood Problem. This part discusses childhood problems like attention, hyperactivity, fear, and anxiety, what triggers these problems, and available treatments. You’ll also learn various theories about the causes of ADHD and its treatment.


  10. Problems of Adolescence: The focus of this part of our Child Psychology, Safeguarding and Early Child Development course is drug abuse and treatment. You’ll also learn about biological theories and lots more.


  11. Introduction to Safeguarding Children: Throughout this section, you will learn what safeguarding is, who is most vulnerable, and all the essential principles behind it.


  12. Laws and Guidance: This part of the course breaks down the key legal frameworks that underpin child protection and safeguarding practices.


  13. Child Abuse: Any inappropriate or abusive behavior toward a child by an adult is considered child abuse. The various types of child abuse are covered in this part, along with their signs and consequences for learners.


  14. Sexual Abuse: We will go over how to identify a child who is at risk of sexual abuse in this section of the course. Additionally, the discussion will inform learners on the consequences and impacts of sexual abuse.


  15. Risks And Risk Assessment: The risk factors for domestic violence and how to identify the harm to children will be covered in this course. In addition, we will talk about ways to make it safe for kids to learn in schools.


  16. Responding to Disclosure and Reporting: This session focuses on teaching you how to react when a child admits that they have experienced abuse in a variety of ways. This session also covers how to report child abuse when you notice it.


  17. Protective Factors for Child Maltreatment: This section will go over the six protective factors of child maltreatment and provide an overview of each one.


  18. Record Keeping: You will learn about safeguarding, making strategic record-keeping decisions, and much more in this part of our Child Psychology, Safeguarding, and Early Childhood Development course.


  19. Online Safety: You will learn about internet safety and dangerous online challenges in this part of our course. Additionally, you will learn about online safety considerations for managers and education for the connected world.


  20. Development and Problems for Children: From this section, you will learn about child development stages and areas. You will also learn about sleep, parenting, and intellectual disabilities.


  21. Safeguarding Disabled Children: Aside from learning how to involve and listen to disabled children, this lesson will also provide you with guidance on the purpose and practice of working with disabled children.


  22. Laws and Regulations for Keeping Children Safe in Education: Everyone who works in a school or college must be trained in safeguarding children from abuse. Here we will teach you about the child-centered approach to safeguarding, keeping children safe in education (KCSE), and other related topics.

courseDetails.title: FIDIC Red Book 2017 – COMPREHENSIVE COURSE
courseDetails.shortDescription: FIDIC REDBOOK WITHOUT THE COMPLICATED LEGAL JARGON WITH REAL EXAMPLES AND IMPLICATIONS
courseDetails.longDescription:
Whether you’re a contractor, consultant, engineer, or project manager, understanding the FIDIC Red Book (2017 – 2nd Edition) is essential for navigating modern construction contracts. This clause-by-clause course will help you master the roles, responsibilities, rights, and remedies under the contract — with a practical, project-based approach.

THIS IS AN ONGOING COURSE WITH NEW LECTURES EVERY WEEK

Unlike legal theory courses, this class is built from real-world construction experience in high-value projects across the UAE, Saudi Arabia, and beyond. Every clause is explained in plain language with examples from live projects, claim scenarios, and site risks to show how the FIDIC Red Book applies on the ground.

What You’ll Learn:


  • Understand each clause of the FIDIC Red Book 2017 in detail

  • Learn how to avoid disputes and protect your contractual position

  • Interpret contract obligations for the Employer, Engineer, and Contractor

  • Handle subcontracting, site conditions, claims, and project delays

  • Navigate practical issues like safety, quality, and payment risks

  • Learn when and how to raise Notices, prepare claims, and trigger determinations


Who Should Take This Course?


  • Construction Project Managers & Site Engineers

  • Contract Administrators & Planning Engineers

  • Consultants, Architects, and Quantity Surveyors

  • Lawyers and legal professionals new to FIDIC

  • Anyone involved in FIDIC contract implementation


About the Instructor:

Ubair Riyaz is a seasoned Planning & Contracts Manager with 10+ years of experience in high-profile Middle East projects. He specializes in FIDIC-based contract administration, EOT claim preparation, and AI-driven workflows for construction teams.
